title: Everyday English Course 78
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

questionTemplates.text:

{a}

questionTemplates.text:
Woman: Dr. Brown's Clinic. Can I help you?
Man: Yes. Can I have an appointment to see the doctor, please?
Woman: Well, he's free at a quarter past eleven today or tomorrow at a quarter past ten or five to two.
Man: I'll come tomorrow afternoon.
{a}

variables.a: What time is the appointment?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Excuse me, I'm enrolled to take Professor Lee's literature course 102 and I hear some changes have been made.
M: Yes, the class has been moved to the north building. Also it is now Tuesdays and Thursdays from 2 to 4pm. Instead of being held on Monday and Friday from 2 to 3pm. What changes!
W: Professor Lee will still be teaching the class, right?
{a}

variables.a: What is NOT a change to the literature class?

answerOptions: Telling her son not to worry.

questionTemplates.text:

M: Thanks, same to you. Doing anything exciting?
W: No, not really. We were thinking of going to the beach, but I don't think Martin is well enough to go. So he will probably stay in and watch TV. And I'll plant the rose bushes I bought yesterday.
{a}
